title: The Canon Crusades
text:
r/StarshipDebates HEATED THREAD (47k comments, locked by mods):

u/PhotonPurist: The Enterprise would DESTROY a Star Destroyer. FACTS:
- Shields that work in space (not just planets)
- Teleporters (board and disable)
- Photon torpedoes (way stronger than lasers)
- Better captain speeches

u/SithLord1977: LMAOOO your 'facts' are hilarious
- Death Star one-shots planets
- Force users predict everything
- AT-ATs would crush redshirts
- Empire has better theme music (John Williams > random beeps)

u/PhotonPurist: I ran 47,000 simulations in my custom physics engine (I'm an actual physicist btw). Trek wins 98.3% of scenarios. My peer-reviewed paper: www.totallyreal.edu/trekwins

u/WormholeExpert: Actually *adjusts glasses* if we calculate the energy output based on stated canon...
*Posts 5,000 word essay with equations*
*Nobody reads it*

u/CasualFan2020: hey what if they just became friends and fought the borg together :)
↳ [-2,847 points] 'GET OUT CASUAL'

u/SithLord1977: Your 'physicist' claim is BS. I checked - you teach high school chemistry

u/PhotonPurist: AD HOMINEM ATTACK! Classic Wars fan move!

u/BattlestarBro: *Eating popcorn* Meanwhile BSG would wreck both lol
↳ [Thread derails into 3-way war]

MOD MESSAGE: Locked. Again. Y'all took 'Star Wars' too literally. Touch grass. Watch other shows. Please.

u/PhotonPurist: [FINAL POST] Starting new sub: r/TrekSupremacy. Wars fans will be banned on sight using my algorithm that detects midichlorian sympathizers

#TrekVsWars #CanonFights #SpaceSupremacy #NerdRage
claim: The Enterprise would definitively beat a Star Destroyer based on 47,000 physics simulations and canon evidence

emotion.explanation: Extreme emotional investment in fictional superiority

agenda.explanation: Creating echo chambers to enforce fictional canon

dimensionAnalysis.logic: Applying real physics to fictional universes with different rules - 47,000 simulations of impossible scenarios, fake peer review links.
dimensionAnalysis.emotion: Tribal warfare over entertainment franchises - extreme hostility to casual fans, 'Touch grass' from mods shows detachment from reality.
dimensionAnalysis.balanced: Suggestion of crossover friendship gets -2,847 downvotes - any non-combative view is violently rejected by both sides.
dimensionAnalysis.agenda: Creating segregated communities based on franchise loyalty - algorithm to detect and ban 'midichlorian sympathizers' shows cult-like behavior.

logicalFallacies.example: Only options are total victory or defeat, no nuance allowed
Claims physicist credentials (actually teaches high school)
Attacks person rather than addressing arguments

logic.explanation: Treating fiction as measurable reality with fake science

emotion.explanation: Identity so tied to fiction that disagreement feels like personal attack

wisdom: This captures how fan communities turn entertainment into ideological warfare. The '47,000 simulations' of fictional battles and fake physicist claims show how tribalism disguises itself as logic. The casual fan suggesting friendship gets destroyed, showing how extremism rejects moderation. The mod's 'touch grass' plea highlights the reality disconnect.
